text: hi everyone today I'm so excited to
share with you what I think is the
ultimate summer birthday cake a blondie
ice cream cake so I'm starting with the
blondie layer which is basically one
giant chocolate-chip cookie so here I
have one in 3/4 cups of all-purpose
flour to that I'm adding 1 teaspoon of
baking powder and 3/4 teaspoon of salt
because the vanilla ice cream is so
sweet I like to make the Blondie's a
little bit on the saltier side well with
our dry ingredients together
since this is basically one big cookie
you're making it just like you would any
other cookie dough
all right that's combined and now I'm
starting with my butter and my sugar so
here I have one stick plus 6 tablespoons
of unsalted butter at room temperature
so now I'm adding 1 and 1/3 cup of light
brown sugar and 1/3 of a cup of
granulated sugar now I'll mix this on
medium high until it's light and fluffy
takes a couple of minutes
all right fluffy butter here so I'll
give a scrape down the sides and now on
medium speed I'm going to add two eggs
these are room temperature it helps if
all of your ingredients are at room
temperature to make a nice fluffy cookie
then once out combined at the second egg
I'll give that another scrape and now
we'll turn it on to low speed and add
the flour mixture in want to make sure
you do this on low so that it doesn't go
flying everywhere
now I'm going to fold in my chocolate
chips incorporate the last bit of flour
with my chocolate chips but I don't over
mix the dough so this is 1 and 1/3 cup
of semi-sweet chocolate chips you can
always use chopped chocolate if you want
to but this is kind of the iconic cookie
look alright that's combined so now I
have a 9 by 13 baking pan and this has
been buttered I put some parchment down
with little overhang so that you can
take it out easily and then I buttered
it again so nothing sticks pour this
right in looks so delicious and fluffy a
little bit spread this evenly into your
pan when it bakes it'll be about an inch
tall so it's it looks like a thin layer
here but it's just perfect for lining
the bottom of your ice cream cake
alright last corner here now this is
going into a 350 degree oven for 35 to
40 minutes until a tester comes out
clean
[Music]
my Blondie's are ready I've let them
cool completely just going to wiggle
them out of the pan using a paring knife
just run along the edge where you don't
have parchment and these smell amazing
by the way there's anything better than
the smell of freshly baked blondie so
now I'll take my 8-inch springform pan
take out the bottom and we're going to
use this to trace the base of my cake
you can just run a knife along the
inside of your springform all the way
around like that now I'll just
reassemble my cake pan here and fit this
in just like that fits right in so now
with the rest of this I'm going to cut
this into 3/4 of an inch squares not too
big you can't bite through them when
they're frozen but you want kind of good
size
I'm going to go grab my ice cream so now
for the ice cream layer I have four
pints of softened vanilla ice cream let
this out for a little bit if you want
you can always put this in a stand mixer
and kind of use the paddle attachment to
soften it up and then I'm adding 1 and
1/2 cups of blondie bytes and the rest
of these I'll save for garnish on top of
my cake now you just want to gently fold
these in they're a little crumbly but
that's okay so you'll get little cookie
crumbs throughout your cakes
everyone wants a bite of blondie in
their ice cream cake and I will just
scoop this into my springform that has
the cookie layer on the bottom oh it's
that ice cream there are a few things
more satisfying than ice cream on a hot
summer day load it all in there kind of
press it in now I use a mini offset
spatula to smooth it all out on top you
do want to make this fairly smooth since
you are going to be putting your caramel
layer on top because you'll be able to
see all the little bump right now I'm
going to freeze this until it's very
very solid at least eight hours you want
to make sure this is really really cold
so while my cake chills and making my
chocolate caramel sauce to do that I'm
adding 1/2 cup of granulated sugar and
three tablespoons of water just going to
swirl this together in my saucepan I'm
cooking this over medium-high heat until
it turns a deep amber color which will
take about six to eight minutes we do
want to take this pretty dark because
the bitterness kind of nice with all of
the sweet ice cream all right now I'm
going to turn off the heat so it will
keep cooking a little bit and I'm adding
three tablespoons of unsalted butter be
careful because it will squash up a
little bit a quarter teaspoon of salt
and half a cup of heavy cream
get this little wisp
nice and smooth beautiful lovely deep
caramel now that that's combined I'll
add a third of a cup of chopped
chocolate this is one and a half ounces
of semi-sweet chocolate I like to add
the chocolate last because the other
ingredients help to cool off the
caramels but you don't scorch the
chocolate now I'm pouring this into a
heat proof Bowl beautiful smooth sauce
and I'm going to put this in the fridge
for about 30 minutes until it's the
consistency of thick hot fudge but not
totally solid
you want it to still be pourable for
your cake so my cake is nice and cold
very firm I've unmolded it from the
springform and now I'm ready to glaze so
here I have my cooled caramel really
important that this isn't any warmer
than room temperature otherwise your
cake will melt from right under the
glaze houses pour this on top look how
beautiful I love the way that ribbons
are so delicious now I'll just use my
offset to spread towards the edge of the
cake you just want to let it drip over
the sides so tantalizing all right that
looks good so now I'm going to let this
chill for one more hour it's ready how
incredible does this look we're just
going to throw a few blondie bites right
on top it's nice to do this after the
cake has chilled so that the blondie
bites are still nice and soft I think
that looks pretty good and now here I
have a knife in some warm water to swipe
this clean this will help us cut through
the ice cream dig right in and use a
little pressure to get through the
blondie at the bottom other wife nice
big slice of ice cream cake
Wow look at that I mean come on you've
got a layer of blondie you have a layer
of ice cream you've got the spongy
caramel topping look how good this looks
I mean what more could you want this is
the ultimate summer dessert we have more
fun ideas over at Martha Stewart calm
enjoy mmm this is so good
